column4: Help: System monitor show 0 bytes swap memory used. Is this correct?
Help: System monitor show 0 bytes swap memory used. Is this correct?
yep, all good :)
mjbrooks: I have only 3*256 ram, I am running virtual machine. Before I start it I have to shutdown firefox, gedit,etc,etc. If swap is not used it is very bad for me
swap will get used when you run out of RAM
as long as swap is enabled ofcourse
mjbrooks: I never run out of memory, instead my ubuntu hang up
mjbrooks: ... or virtual machine hang up
mjbrooks: swap is acceptable because at least I need firefox + virtualbox + pidgin at the same time
mjbrooks: 320 ram for virtual machine, so VirtualBox take 360 ram.
mjbrooks: right now it is 570 MB used (of 755 MB total). If I start, firefox it will takes 150 MB more.
mjbrooks: sure, I will reduce virtual machine memory... but do you think my settings are wrong? Can I force linux to use more swap (not for virtual machine but for everything else)
mjbrooks: or do you think it can't find swap partition (I do not know which log file to check)
if you can pastebin the contents of   /etc/fstab   we can see if swap exists
mjbrooks: ok, so you think everything is normal. I did worry what if my swap partition is not visible/available for linux. Will paste fstab, as I see it is ok.
mjbrooks: please: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/63265/
anythings possible, but not always a good idea ;)
that is why, if I did wrong installation (few months back) I want to fix it
looks fine, I assume your swap partition is atleast as big as your amount of RAM, plus a little more? Not that that matters as you don't seem to be hitting the swap
mjbrooks: as I remember, swap must be 1GB. Please: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/63268/
looks fine to me
